New Records: The Celtics tied the franchise record for made 3's in a half
The Celtics tied the NBA record for total made 3's
The Celtics broke the record for 3's on opening night
Key Match Events: The Celtics took a massive 43-24 lead at the end of the 1st quarter
The Knicks actually outshot the Celtics from the field, but the Celtics excellent ball control allowed them to attempt 17 more shots
The Celtics finished just one 3-pointer away from claiming the NBA record for most made 3's in a single game
Pre-Game Insights: The Celtics had a busy offseason, but they had every reason to start off slow in their first real game
The Knicks wanted this to be a statement game, but the Celtics were fueled by these circumstances
The Celtics ability to get creative with their matchups defensively was a key factor in their hot start
Post-Match Reflections: Jayson Tatum was special in this game, finishing with 37 points and 10 assists
Derrick White was his typical exceptional two-way self, forcing a ton of missed shots and chipping in with six 3's
Jrue Holiday has settled into a role that requires significantly less usage, but he's found ways to maximize every second he's on the floor
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Celtics' 3PT hunting and proficiency has made watching every other team less enjoyable in comparison
The Celtics' offense has infiltrated the minds of Celtics fans, and it's past the point of no return
The Knicks wing duo of Bridges and Anunoby struggled, being nonexistent on the offensive end
